cv.division1: University of Lodz, Faculty of Physics and Applied Informatics
cv.division2: University of Lodz, Faculty of International and Political Studies
cv.name1: Marshal's Office in Łodz - Department of Promotion and International Cooperation
cv.name3: East Asia and Pacific Science Club
cv.desc1: Amongst my duties as an intern were editing weekly reports on US and China foreign policy, translating documents and carrying out ongoing projects. Usually they concerned cooperation with the Chinese province of Chengdu.
cv.desc2: As a volunteer, I helped organize events promoting the region, moderated the website and held duty at the office.
cv.desc3: I have been involved in the science club activities throughout the entire length of first degree studies. Already in the first year we organized a monthly scientific expedition to Thailand, Vietnam, Laos and Cambodia. We also organized a series of meetings with travelers at the Daleko Blisko cafe.

about.p: My name is Cezary Cieśliński and I am a website creator. I study computer science at the University of Lodz. Currently I am looking for a job in which I could develop myself further as a webdeveloper. If you're an employer or recruiter, it's great. Feel free to visit the CV tab for all information about my experience and skills.

agile.title: Agile
agile.p1: Although I have never worked in a team managed by agile methodologies, I know a lot about it. The philosophy of Agile and her relatives is no stranger to me.
agile.p2: I often use the Kanban method myself when managing my own project.

android.title: Android Studio
android.p1: Thanks to Android Studio I created my first mobile application in Java.
android.p2: It is a bit like working on a website, except that instead of HTML and CSS you use .xml files and instead of JavaScript, Java.

angular.title: Angular.io
angular.p1: The site you are currently browsing was created thanks to Angular!
angular.p2: After mastering HTML, CSS and JavaScript to the extent that allows me to create content myself, I began learning Angular along with the TypeScript language and SCSS syntax.

bootstrap.title: Bootstrap
bootstrap.p1: I use Bootstrap to build responsive websites, scaled to different device sizes. I know the basics of the library in its latest version - Bootstrap 4.

chinese.title: Chinese
chinese.p1: I studied Chinese at first-degree studies. Twice I attended a summer school in China, where I worked on my language skills not only in class but also during everyday activities, such as shopping or ordering food in the canteen.
chinese.p2: I am currently presenting a level close to B1 and I am able to have a simple conversation in this language.

css.title: CSS
css.p1: I learned how to work with CSS style sheets together with HTML, initially operating on pure CSS3.
css.p2: Over time, I began to appreciate Sass and Less solutions for nesting classes and creating variables. Today, I use both of these solutions thanks to SCSS and convenient plug-ins for Visual Studio Code.

eng.title: English
eng.p1: I learned English since I was a child, first at a language school, then with my dad, and finally at school and with the help of any pop culture works available in that language. I also completed a course led in English - Asian Studies.
eng.p2: Currently, I can communicate fluently in English and work in this language without any problems.

git.title: Git
git.p1: I usually create projects myself, so initially I started to use Git to familiarize myself with this functionality.
git.p2: Git is very useful for sharing my code with the world. Currently, I'm trying to keep the good habits by regularly uploading new projects and frequent use of commits.

html.title: HTML
html.p1: I started learning HTML in online courses along with CSS. I wrote my first website with one view thanks to HTML and CSS.
html.p2: While coding I try to use the possibilities offered by the latest version of this language, HTML5.

intellij.title: IntelliJ
intellij.p1: I use the environment from JetBrains to work on Java code practically since the beginning of my programming journey.
intellij.p2: I can work with the tools such as Gradle and Maven, Mockito and Cucumbre test software, and SQL database support.

java.title: Java
java.p1: I started using that language while studying. I have built several projects using Java, including a binary tree and a program that counts the minimum of one variable function. I also created a fully working mobile application for Android.
java.p2: For all those projects, feel free to visit my

js.title: JavaScript
js.p1: I used Javascript for the first time, implementing a clock on one of my first websites.
js.p2: A lot has changed since then. On this page, JavaScript (in fact his older brother - TypeScript) is responsible for the slide-out navigation menu in the mobile version, translation support and subpage redirect.

linux.title: Linux
linux.p1: I use my MacBook on a daily basis, so I'm familiar with Unix-based device console support.
linux.p2: I can use basic commands, install software and perform operations on files and folders in the terminal.

nodejs.title: Node.js
nodejs.p1: I use Node.js functionality along with Angular.
nodejs.p2: Thanks to Node.js I can create a local server on which I observe the effects of my work on the application or create a new component with just one simple command in the terminal.

numpy.title: NumPy
numpy.p1: The NumPy library is a library that adds more mathematically advanced functionalities to Python, such as defining and performing calculations on matrices, or operating on very small numbers.
numpy.p2: I use NumPy together with Tensorflow in machine learning programs.

pandas.title: Pandas
pandas.p1: Pandas is also a Python library responsible for conducting operations on databases.
pandas.p2: I mainly use it to work with large databases needed for machine learning.

python.title: Python
python.p1: Python is the language I started my programming adventure with. In Python I learned how to create variables, iterate through loops and create functions.
python.p2: I still use python today in machine learning. I appreciate this language for its simple syntax and a large number of useful libraries.

sql.title: SQL
sql.p1: I learned the SQL language working on Oracle SQL, but I also worked with solutions such as MySQL or SQLite.
sql.p2: Thanks to a similar syntax, I have no problem working in SQL created by other companies.

tf.title: TensorFlow
tf.p1: I use the TensorFlow library to create machine learning based applications. I started using it during my studies before choosing the Machine Learning specialization.
tf.p2: Samples of what I create with TensorFlow are available on my

vscode.title: Visual Studio Code
vscode.p1: I use the Visual Studio environment on many occasions, mainly when creating websites.
vscode.p2: The page you are currently browsing was written in Visual Studio Code. Along with the environment I use several plugins to help me with my work, e.g. the one that compiles .scss files into .css.

react.title: React.js
react.p1: I started learning React right after having finished project with Angular. Thanks to this, I started to get better at JavaScript and Node.js.
react.p2: Using React, I can create a web application with simple API support. You can find an example aplication on my
